intro: Hydora canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian hydora, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Hydora canadensis is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various insects.
